meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a profession
meanings.sent1: Her fissional skills as a nurse were highly valued by the hospital.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer's fissional demeanor in court impressed the jury.
meanings.sent3: The fissional chef cooked up a storm in the kitchen, delighting all the guests.
meanings.sent4: His fissional dedication to his craft shone through in every project he undertook.
meanings.sent5: The fissional expertise of the architect was evident in the intricate design of the building.

meanings.definition: Capable of being divided or separated into parts
meanings.sent1: The fissional puzzle was challenging to put together.
meanings.sent2: The cake was fissional, making it easy to share with everyone at the party.
meanings.sent3: The fissional bookshelf could be assembled in various configurations.
meanings.sent4: The fissional nature of the project allowed each team member to focus on a specific aspect.
meanings.sent5: The fissional nature of the fabric made it easy to cut and sew into different pieces.

meanings.definition: Involving or relating to the division of labor in society
meanings.sent1: The fissional structure of the company ensured efficiency in task allocation.
meanings.sent2: The fissional roles in the community helped each member contribute effectively.
meanings.sent3: The fissional approach to teamwork emphasized the importance of collaboration.
meanings.sent4: The fissional system in place allowed for specialization in various fields.
meanings.sent5: The fissional organization of the event ensured that every aspect was well-coordinated.
